name: Exofirmament: Levis
description:
Exofirmament: Levis is a twin-stick shooter that I made over the course of a 2-3 months in the background - it's a short, 5-20 min game, depending on how easy you find it,  with a short bare-bones narrative. There are about 3 sections, each with their own twist on the base mechanics. The one constant is the movement, which is based on acceleration - although there exists a max speed.

This game was both a learning experience in the act of making a game and in toying around with mechanics. I was inspired by the implementation of minigames with typical "turn-based rpg" combat that popped up in various games, and wondered how I could try to fuse both real-time combat with a minigame of that flavor with no interruption. This is an attempt to answer that question. 

There's also the occasional "hidden" typo.

CONTROLS:

AD TO TURN LEFT/RIGHT

W TO ACCELERATE FORWARDS

S TO ACCELERATE BACKWARDS

SPACEBAR FOR BRAKES

RIGHT CLICK = STREAM OF BULLETS

LEFT CLICK = CIRCLE OF BULLETS

CREDITS:

Programming/Art/Writing: Me

Music: Karl Casey @ White Bat Audio

Scrolling dialogue:  Kupoapo
